Text.val: -- v.DEBC_NO is initialized with PI.DEBC_NO and updated with PI.DEBC_NO (same
value) to achieve a re-computed to display some Euler Hermes related fields on
screen (grade values)

// program handles the credit limit requests an tje info sources used
// for this requests. The info sources will stored first in the
// TEMP file to work with them and later stored in CLSR

Pushbutton handling
at least "query" rights
-- Check for existing CLCR row and upadate variables for screen
...only if ODC110A1 is started the first from main tab, initialize the temp
table with limit request (CLSR)
-- Check if limit decision is possible if a new credit limit request was added
or an exsiting one was modified
call online task
... in case of a new source request is added, the temp table for the tabular
view of source requests has to be rebuilt
.. perform re-compute on DEBC to achieve the display of updated DEBC variables
in case of source requests
-- Create / Update CLCR (button OK or source request screen is activated)
... call online task again, if the source request view has to be activated
cancel answer = 'N'
cancel answer ='Y'
// use expression <>'N' ! Because, if there are no changes, you get
// no message box !!
// end CANCEL
//Delete answer = 'Y'
Automatic process

SQL_STMT_U.val: select cast (sum (INVO_AACTUALC) as decimal (13,2)) from :1/INVO where exists (select DEBH_NO from :1/DEBH where DEBH_NO = INVO_DEBH_NO and DEBH_LEGALOWNER_DEBH = :2) and (INVO_AACTUALC < 0 or (INVO_AACTUALC > 0 and INVO_DUEDATE < ':3'))

Text.val: only enable, if client request = 'Y'
only enable, if charging costs = 'Y'
-- Goto source request screen, CLCR updates have to be performed always
before, then we need the current CLCR values for source requests
-- see R.P. where program is called after the database updates are finished
-- Init screen variables
...only if ODC110A1 is started the first from main tab, use variables from CLCR
row where CLCR_REQSTATUS < 5 (decided)
... if called form ODH001F use credit limit from debtor clent
... update working variables
-- Recalculate grade amount
-- The users clicks on the source request view before, so start view and
position cursor in this program
-- If a source request is added perform a screen refresh
update charging costs, if client request is set to 'N'
LEAVE PROGRAM
save record
-- Credit limit tests
... check if limit already exits at other debtor
... no limit allowed on branch office
currency requested does not exist
//SCR #9040 JP add test on CLCR_DATE
currency charging costs does not exist
bank-id from initialisation advice does not exist
bank-amount from initialisation advice does not exist
limit requests on deleted debtors are not allowed
// end VALIDATION
... reset costs, if client request is set to 'N'
//currency requested does not exist
-- Recalculate grade amount

Text.valUnicode: Original name / address / city supplied by client

ExpSyntax.val: VarMod ('{0,5}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,7}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,11}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,13}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,14}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,15}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,16}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,17}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,24}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,25}'VAR) OR VarMod ('{0,26}'VAR)

Text.val: -- Set variables
-- Additional test to check if there already exists a limit request for the
current debtor (if TRUE it's not allowed to add a new one)
--> Maybe test not necessary, becasue in case of existing CLCR row where
CLCR_REQSTATUS < 5 the values of this row are used to populate
CCR variables on screen (SH SCR12345 04.05.2007)
-- Storing of limit request has to be skipped, because there exist already one
.. leave program
-- else store limit request
... fetch new CLCR_NO, if no CLCR record exist
-- Store Limit request values
... only if a new CLCR row is added before, to avoid probems with the statistics
-- It's not allowed to enter a new limit request for the debtor if there exist
an 'open' limit request (CLCR_REQSTATUS < 5)
-- Always store a row to message queue, because of CLCR_REQSTATUS = 4
-- Delete last selected MQDT
-- Delete previous selected MQDT row

-- ODC210A is called at the end of ODC110A1
-- Finance limits
-- ODC210A is called at the end of ODC110A1
